version_description:
Big Update! SignEasy is iOS 10 ready with the following new features:

• Get rich information about an incoming signature request right on the locked screen.
• Draw a beautiful signature with our support for Apple Pencil.
• Peek and preview any document and even act on it without having to actually open the document.
• Take relevant actions on your push notifications, like Accept or Decline a signature request, on iOS 9 and 10 devices.
• New 3D Touch Home Screen option for Pending document.

PS: Devices on iOS 8 won't receive any more updates.

From previous updates:
Introducing Request Signature on SignEasy for iOS - get documents signed by anyone remotely.

Here is how it works:
• Open an original document and tap on 'Remote Signing'.
• Add a list of signers who need to sign the document and send a request.
• Once all the signers have signed, everyone receives the final signed document.

So what are you waiting for? Install the app and give it a spin.

Love the app? Don't forget to leave a review on the App Store.

For bugs or feedback, email us at support@getsigneasy.com.

100,000 Lines of Code written.
8,460 Man and Woman hours.
706 Bugs found and squashed.
131 Iterations.
50 Beta users.
4 Testers.
3 Developers.
1 Goal.

The biggest update in SignEasy history is here. It’s the eSignature app you know and love but we’ve rewritten the entire app from the ground up to make use of the best of iOS. Experience faster loading times, a much smoother navigation and innovation at a much greater pace in the weeks to come.

iOS 11 - The best thing to happen to paperwork.

When Apple unveiled the drag and drop feature at the developer conference at WWDC 2017, our engineers returned with a glint in their eyes.

What emerged is a labor of love, powered by grit, late nights, and way too much coffee. Here are SignEasy’s latest improvements and tune-ups:

• Importing and exporting files has become super seamless. With the Mail app open alongside SignEasy, drag and drop any attachment into SignEasy and get the job done.
• Putting together paperwork is now easier than ever! While editing your document, drag and drop your logo, an image or piece of text into SignEasy from any supported app.
• Once you’ve finished signing, share documents by dragging them from the document list to any other app!
• Now find all your signed documents directly from any app, including the new Files app! Simply select Browse -> SignEasy and pick your file.

Give the latest SignEasy app a spin and shoot us a mail at support@getsigneasy.com to let us know what you think. Meanwhile, we have to look for our engineers; they might be camping out at another conference, waiting for inspiration to hit again.

We’ve unlocked the gates! Starting today, you can use your credits to sign documents yourself or send them out for signature to remote parties. Fire up the app and try it now.

Wait, have you run out of credits? Write to us at support@getsigneasy.com and we’ll refill your account with a free credit - it’s on us!

We’re wrapping up 2017 by knocking off an army of bugs, and ringing in 2018 with some great improvements, most requested by our awesome users! Here are a *few* we think you will definitely notice:

• Add time along with a date when signing your documents.
• Ability to sort your Google Drive files.
• iPhone X: Enable Face ID from the app settings to really help us make sure it’s You signing the document.
• iPhone X: Fixed a bug where performing bulk actions on the document list were proving to be difficult.
• Text resizing on zoomed documents is now accurate.
• Fixed an issue where multiple check marks weren’t maintaining their size when signing a document.

If you’d like to see a feature in 2018 or have a pesky bug you’re tired of dealing with, write to us at support@getsigneasy.com and the Product team here will definitely get back to you asap. We promise.

Introducing a more modern look to your favorite e-signature app, that makes every interaction more intuitive, more fluid, and even easier to use. This fresh new interface brings all of your SignEasy needs just one tap away.

• New bottom toolbar: access your document library easily, switch over to your active documents with one tap, and hop over to your account details to update your settings in no time.
• Build your profile: save your personal details for re-use and add them quickly to your documents.
• Signature scanner: turn your phone camera into a scanner to keep your signature and initials accurate, and up to date.
• Centralized import options: uploading your documents to SignEasy just got easier.

Fire up the app to try out the new look today!

Automatic strong password
On iOS 12, you can now set up your SignEasy account using an iOS suggested strong password to ensure your account details are safely stored and accessible from your keychain across your iPhone, iPad, and Safari on Mac.

Have you ever signed a document with your face? Now you can!

With this update, you can now enable Face ID as a second layer of authentication when signing documents. Additionally, this information will be added to the audit trail of the document - yet another pillar that upholds our commitment to safe, secure, legally-binding digital signatures.

And that’s not all - you can also enable Face ID authentication on app launch to secure access to your documents.

Fire up the app and try out the new updates today!

***From past releases***
• Better support and handling of long text when filling forms.
• Improved Search experience to help you find your documents instantly.
• Dark Mode support to conserve battery and a crisp viewing experience.
• Built-in document scanner to easily bring physical documents into SignEasy.
• Multiple window support on iPadOS to open multiple documents simultaneously.

Remote work is on the rise and so is the need for collecting signatures remotely. You can now use your favorite 'Sign with SignEasy' option to send documents for signature as well without leaving Mail or your favorite cloud applications.

Simply share a document using the Sign with SignEasy option and select "Request Signature" from the options at the top. Fill up the list of signers, add an optional message, and hit send. It's as easy as that!

Easily import documents from your device to SignEasy using the Copy to SignEasy option:
- Open the document on your iPhone/iPad from Files, Mail, or any other app.
- Tap the 'Share' button while you are viewing it.
- To import your document, tap "SignEasy". (In case you are not seeing SignEasy upfront, swipe right or tap on 'more'.)
- You can sign, request signatures from others, and more after importing the document.

To new beginnings!

Also, with this update, we have fixed some bugs and improved performance. Let us know what you think. Have a question or feedback to share that we are all listening to support@signeasy.com.

New SignEasy; familiar easy of use!
● Introducing Home
The new Home screen shows a quick summary of your documents’ status so that you are always on top of things.

● Adding annotations is fun!
See all annotations in one view. Just tap on the document to bring them up. Also, we've added 'Name' annotation to help you fill your paperwork faster.

● Haptics provides better feedback
We have added haptic feedback on key events like signature success, reminders, and more.
Not a fan of Haptic feedback? Turn it off from Account > Advanced Features.

● QR codes for Template sharing
You can now generate a QR code to share the Single Signer Templates for a truly contactless signing experience. You can print the QR code for regular offline usage.
On the "Template Details" screen, toggle on "Template Link" and tap on "Generate QR Code".

Note: Templates can be created on the SignEasy web app (log in using your existing account). Templates are available under Pro and Business plans.

This is our biggest update to date in terms of user experience. A lot more exciting features and enhancements are in the works. We hope you like it.
